data.title: Full list of all Samsung Galaxy phones with prices to help you choose
data.meta_description: Here is a full list of Samsung Galaxy smartphones including their UK prices and upcoming release dates. Find out which Samsung phone is right for you.
data.text:
Samsung's collection of mid-range phones starts at under £350 with the Galaxy A32, while the most expensive Samsung is the 1TB version of the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6, which comes in at a whopping £2,099. Truly, there's an option for almost any budget.

As a rule, these new Samsung phones have impressed us. Our experts have tested several of the new handsets, and it's safe to say Samsung has created some of the very best Android phones on the market right now.

While it’s great there is more choice than ever, keeping track of which handsets are still on sale in the UK and at what price can be trickier than you may expect. So, we've done the legwork for you, and collated a list of every single Galaxy smartphone available right now.

More like this

To help you find the right Samsung smartphone for you, we've also included release date information, key features and specs, as well as the all-important price to ensure every budget is catered for. 5G support is also included with most handsets on this list, along with solid displays, performance, software updates and camera set-ups.

Make sure you check out the new Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 release dates. Plus, did you know there's a new Samsung Galaxy Ring?

Samsung Galaxy phones at a glance: newest to oldest

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 July 2024 | from £1,049

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 July 2024 | from £1,799

Samsung Galaxy A35 March 2024 | from £339

Samsung Galaxy A55 March 2024 | from £439

Samsung Galaxy S24 January 2024 | from £799

Samsung Galaxy S24+ January 2024 | from £999

Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra January 2024 | from £1,249

Samsung Galaxy S23 FE December 2023 | from £599

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 July 2023 | from £1,049

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 July 2023 | from £1,749

Samsung Galaxy A34 March 2023 | from £349

Samsung Galaxy A54 March 2023 | from £449

Samsung Galaxy S23, February 2023 | from £849

Samsung Galaxy S23+, February 2023 | from £1,049

Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, February 2023 | from £1,249

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4, August 2022 | £1,649

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4, August 2022 | £999

Samsung Galaxy A53, April 2022 | £399

Samsung Galaxy A33, April 2022 | £329

Samsung Galaxy S22+, March 2022 | from £949

Samsung Galaxy S22, March 2022 | from £769

Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, February 2022 | from £1,149

Samsung Galaxy S21 FE, January 2022 | from £699

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G, August 2021 | from £1,599

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip3, August 2021 | from £949

Full Samsung Galaxy phones list with prices: newest to oldest

Samsung likes to spread out its smartphone launches throughout the year. Here are all the major Samsung Galaxy phones currently available, with the newest models first.

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 | £1,049

The new Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 was announced in July as part of the Samsung Unpacked event. The flip-phone is perfect for people who want to make a statement with their smartphone — the 1990s are totally back in fashion after all — and its cover screen is a compact 8.6cm, making it the perfect pocket size.

The upgraded Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 also has a 50MP back camera (the same specification as the Samsung Galaxy S24) and a 10MP front camera. Its design bears a 10% improved scratch resistance, plus four new colourways: Mint, Blue, Yellow and Silver Shadow and three online-only colours: Peach, Crafted Black and White.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 at Samsung

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 | £1,799

The all-new Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 bridges the gap between a smartphone and a tablet. When it's open, the brilliant display is great for reading e-books, using the S Pen on the GoodNotes app, and streaming your favourite series and movies.

When it's closed, it functions as a perfectly normal smartphone that, thanks to the lightest and thinnest design yet, can slip comfortably in the pocket.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 has a Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 display, which is the same as the Samsung Galaxy S23 smartphone series. It also boasts a new cover screen ratio allowing for a bar-type viewing experience. And of course, comes with all-new Samsung Galaxy AI.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 at Samsung

Samsung Galaxy A35 | £339

The Samsung Galaxy A35 is the latest for the tech company's mid-range, coming in four new "Awesome" colourways: Awesome Ice Blue, Awesome Lemon, Awesome Lilac, and Awesome Navy.

It has a 6.6-inch display – just a tad smaller than the Samsung Galaxy S24+ – with a Full HD Super AMOLED screen and 120Hz refresh rate. Plus, a Premium glass back and a 50MP camera.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A35 from £339 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A35 from £339 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A35 from £339 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy A55 | £439

Like the A35, the A55 is mid-priced and is obviously less advanced than members of the S or Z range. However, it has a sleek design and good speed, making it perfect for everyday use.

It also shares the S24’s floating three-camera design and has been designed to take clearer and more vibrant photos even in the poorest lighting conditions thanks to AI Image Signal Processing (ISP). The device also has a new Night Portrait mode and 12-bit HDR video to ensure that, no matter the time of day, you’re always looking your most glam and comes with a metal frame to improve durability.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A55 from £439 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A55 from £439 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A55 from £439 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy S24 | £799

The Samsung Galaxy S24 is the cheapest option from the brand-new S Series. It comes in four colours: Onyx Black, Marble Grey, Cobalt Violet and Amber Yellow and, thanks to Samsung's slimmest bezels yet, has an immersive 6.2-inch display. The phone comes with Samsung Galaxy AI, which can do everything from record transcripts and summarise notes to the very exciting Circle to Search function, in which you circle an object from any image or website, and your phone will tell you exactly what or where it is.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 from £799 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 from £799 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 from £799 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy S24+ | £999

The Samsung Galaxy S24+ is slightly bigger than the S24 at 6.7-inches (as oppose to the S23+'s 6.6). Like the other members of the S24 range, it has Samsung Galaxy AI, a 200MP camera and excellent durability with a strengthened aluminium frame.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24+ from £999 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24+ from £999 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24+ from £999 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra | £1,249

The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is the crowning jewel of the S24 range. With the company's first ever Titanium frame, their brightest-ever 6.8-inch flat screen and four new sleek colourways: Titanium Black, Titanium Grey, Titanium Violet and Titanium Yellow, it's a mightily impressive bit of kit.

That's all before you delve into the matter of Samsung Galaxy AI, which can live translate phone calls in other languages, alter the tone of your sentences and edit photos. Plus, it has Samsung's first 5x optical zoom camera which has automatic slow-mo and expert nightography.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra from £1,249 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra from £1,249 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra from £1,249 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy S23 FE, December 2023 | £599

Samsung rounded up their 2023 with the release of the Samsung Galaxy S23 FE. This Fan Edition version of the S23 series shares a lot of the positives with the high-end model. For instance, the camera, although only 50MP to the S23's 200MP, comes with a 3X optical zoom and an after dark, “Nightography” mode, which lets you take clear selfies and portraits at all hours. It also comes with a 4,500mAh battery that can charge up to 50% in just 30 minutes and, most importantly, is significantly cheaper in price.

Buy Samsung Galaxy S23 FE from £599 at Samsung

Buy Samsung Galaxy S23 FE from £599 at Currys

Buy Samsung Galaxy S23 FE from £599 at Argos

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5, July 2023 | £1,049

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 has a compact cover screen that comes in at 3.4-inches, and you can do a whole host of things on it without the need to open your phone, such as answer calls and check the weather. Plus, the cover screen can be easily customised with GIFs, photos, and videos, to truly show off your personality. But it's not just the exterior that impressed the RadioTimes.com team, the device also has fantastic internals and functionality, as well as some improvements to the camera and main display.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 from £1,049 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 from £1,049 at Currys

Read more about this smartphone in our Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 release date page.

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5, July 2023 | £1,749

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 is available in multiple unique colourways that are sure to grab people's attention, such as Icy Blue, Cream and Phantom Black.

Plus, some of the stand-outs of the brand-new Samsung Galaxy Z Fold5 include the enhanced battery life and cooling properties, which have been improved since the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4. As well as interactive short form viewing in social media, a disappearing camera display, and the brightest screen yet on a Z series smartphone.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 from £1,749 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 from £1,749 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy A34, March 2023 | £349

The newest, and most reasonably priced, addition to the Samsung A series, the Samsung Galaxy A34 is available to buy now with prices starting at £349.

Coming in Graphite, Violet, Lime, and Silver, this smartphone has over two days of battery life and can reach full charge in under 90 minutes. Compared to the previous members of the A series, it also has a brighter screen (at 1,000 nits) and a new 'eye-caring' display to prevent the damaging effects of the phone's blue light.

The camera is also improved with new light boosting technology to bring out the light in photos and produce much crisper images.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A34 from £349 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A34 from £349 at Amazon

Samsung Galaxy A54, March 2023 | £449

The Samsung Galaxy A54 has a smaller screen than the A34 (6.4 inches compared to 6.6) and also comes in white. It's prices are a little higher, starting at £449, which is due to features such as the phone's 50MP camera and 8GB of RAM.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A54 from £449 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A54 from £449 at Currys

Samsung Galaxy S23, February 2023 | £849

Part of Samsung's new S23 Series, the Samsung Galaxy S23 is the most affordable smartphone from the trio, coming in at £849.

It has a 6.1-inch display and comes in four different colourways: Phantom Black, Cream, Green, and Lavender. Plus, all of the colours are sourced from plants as part of Samsung’s eco-conscious initiative, which has also seen the manufacturer endeavour to prevent 15 tons of fishing nets from entering the ocean this year. The S23 Series includes 12 recycled internal and external components, too - a 100 per cent increase on the S22’s six recycled internal components.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23 from £849 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23 from £849 at John Lewis

Samsung Galaxy S23+, February 2023 | £1,049

Also new to the S series is the 6.6-inch display Samsung S23+. When we got hands-on with the S23 Series, one feature particularly stood out to us: the camera. The 200MP back-facing camera is high-quality enough to print out photos and create canvases, and the 12MP front-facing camera has super HDR. The brand new adaptive pixel sensor and double OIS camera improves taking photos in the dark, too, as it is more stable in comparison to the S22.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23+ from £1,049 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23+ from £1,049 at JD Williams

Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, February 2023 | £1,249

If you're a gamer, you'll love the brand new Samsung Galaxy S23 Series. With the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, the S23 smartphones process graphics faster than the S22. The new battery life — 5,000mAh for the S23 Ultra — also allows for more gaming time. The S23 Ultra automatically adjusts and enhances the colour and light when you’re gaming in different lights, too.

And there's even more: the Ultra even comes with the S Pen to take photos, write notes and more.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra from £1,249 at Very

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra from £1,249 at Argos

Looking for a saving on Samsung devices? Take a look at the top Samsung offers for this month, and the best Samsung QLED TV deals.

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4, August 2022 | £1,649

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 is packed full of features including a 6.2-inch cover screen, which unfolds to reveal a 7.6-inch main screen. It's also IPX8 water resistant and is S-Pen compatible, all of which come at the high starting price of £1,649.

We've had hands-on time with the Fold 4 and were impressed with its sleek, slimmed down format. You can check out our thoughts over on our full Samsung Galaxy Fold 4 page.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 from £1,649 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 at Carphone Warehouse

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4, August 2022 | £999

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 was revealed in August 2022. It's an eye-catching new foldable that comes in a pleasingly pocketable size.

Available to buy now, the Z Flip 4 is Samsung's latest flip phone model powered by a Snapdragon 8 Gen 1+ processor, and with a more durable Gorilla Glass Victus display.

We've had some hands-on testing time with the Samsung Galaxy Flip 4 and thoroughly enjoyed its wide variety of camera settings and functions, as well as its sleeker, slimmer, yet more durable form-factor.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 from £999 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 at Carphone Warehouse

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 for £1,059 £658.99 (save £400.01 or 38%) at Amazon

Samsung Galaxy A53, April 2022 | £399

The Samsung Galaxy A53 is the latest mid-range smartphone that comes with 5G, priced from £399 in the UK. We reckon it's the best sub-£400 on the market for most people right now, with a great range of features and a good value proposition.

To get the lowdown, be sure to check out our full Samsung Galaxy A53 review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A53 from £399 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A53 from £399 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A53 from £319.99 at Amazon

Samsung Galaxy A33, April 2022 | £329

The Galaxy A33 5G, with a 6.4-inch display and quad camera set-up, is an even more affordable handset in the Galaxy series, priced from £329 in the UK.

It's very similar to the A53 5G with a few more small compromises made to allow for that lower price-point.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A33 from £329 at Currys

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A33 at Carphone Warehouse

Buy the Samsung Galaxy A33 for £329 £248.99 at Amazon

Samsung Galaxy S22+, March 2022 | £999

The Galaxy S22+ is very similar in design to the standard S22 model, but the main visual difference is that it increases the display size from 6.1-inch to 6.6-inch.

For a full breakdown of how it performs, here's our Samsung Galaxy S22 Plus review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22+ from £539.69 at Amazon

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22+ from £949 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22+ from £999 at Very

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22+ from £999 at Currys

Samsung Galaxy S22, March 2022 | £769

The Galaxy S22 is the standard model in the company's 2022 line-up. Visually it looks similar to the previous S21 device, but comes with a slightly smaller display and a newer processor, while the main camera lens has been bumped from 12MP to 50MP.

Read our full Samsung Galaxy S22 hands-on preview.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 from £552.11 at Amazon

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 from £769 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 from £819 at John Lewis

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 from £769 at Very

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 from £769 at Argos

Galaxy S22 Ultra, February 2022 | £1,149

The Galaxy S22 Ultra is Samsung's flagship device for 2022, with a 6.8-inch AMOLED display, up to 120Hz refresh rate, a premium quad-camera set-up and a built-in S Pen. In our review, we called it "one of the best Android phones you can buy today".

Read our full Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra for £801 at Amazon

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra from £1,149 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra for £1,149 at John Lewis

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra for £1,149 at Argos

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra at EE

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra at Three

Samsung Galaxy S21 FE, January 2022 | £699

The Galaxy S21 Fan Edition (FE) boasts a great 6.4-inch display, 120Hz refresh rate and 32 MP front-facing camera. It’s essentially a more affordable version of the flagship Galaxy S21.

Read our full Samsung Galaxy S21 FE review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE from £699 at Samsung

Buy the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE from £499 at Amazon

Galaxy Z Fold3 5G, August 2021 | £1,599

The hulking third-generation Z Fold phone is pricey, but premium with a highly unique foldable frame. It’s 29% brighter compared to the previous model and has a 120Hz refresh rate alongside S Pen functionality. You don't buy this if you’re on a budget but you do if you want a unique smartphone experience that stands out in a crowd.

Read our hands-on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G for £1,028.57 at Amazon

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G from £1,699 at Samsung

Galaxy Z Flip3, August 2021 | £899

The Z Flip3 is a clamshell foldable that’s slightly more portable than the Z Fold3, but still fairly expensive with a price tag of just under £900. The cover screen, which lets you see notifications without opening the handset, was made four times larger than its predecessor from 2020, and it comes in a broad selection of colour choices including Cream, Lavender, Green, Phantom Black, Grey, White and Light Pink.

Read our hands-on Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 review.

Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 for £999 at John Lewis

You can also shop Certified Renewed Galaxy smartphones, such as the Galaxy Note20 and the Galaxy Note20 Ultra, at Samsung.
